bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Jose A. Presno, May 3, 1948

div1.p: Hench discusses further plans for the preservation of Camp Lazear. He inquires if it would be possible for Nogueira to bring Finlay's diaries to America with him so that he can microfilm them.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Jose A. Presno, May 3, 1948
div1.opener:
May 3, 1948
Dr. Jose A. Presno
Presidente de la Academia de Cuncias de la Habana
Cuba 460, Havana
Cuba
My dear Doctor Presno:
div1.p:
Since my return to Rochester, I have been extremely busy but let
me express even now my very sincere appreciation of your courtesies to me
when I visited the Academy. It was a real pleasure to meet you and your
colleagues and to be allowed to see the material in the Academy.

After seeing you, through the help of Doctor Carbonell, I made
further plans regarding the preservation of Camp Lazear than I had expected.
I do hope that those in authority will complete their plans. Permit me to
send you a copy of a letter that I have sent to His Excellency, the Minister
of Public Works. I am greatly interested in this and do hope the project can
be completed. Any way that I can cooperate further I shall be glad to be of
service.

I was quite disappointed not to be able to bring with me the diaries
of Doctor Finlay. I do think it is extremely important to have them microfilmed
so that in case the originals are lost or stolen or destroyed by fire or other-
wise, other copies may be available. I am so anxious to have my American
colleagues know more about the work of Doctor Finlay. I do hope that arrange-
ments can be made in due time to have these diaries microfilmed either in Cuba
or in the United States at the National Archives or the Surgeon General's
Library or the Library of Congress. Would it be permissible to have Doctor
Nogueira bring them along in his own personal custody to Washington and we
could make arrangements to have them microfilmed while he is in this country
and then he could bring the books back. I am sure we could arrange to have
two or three copies of the film, get one for the Surgeon General's Library here,
two for your own Academy (one to keep on file and the other to lend out as neces-
sary, etc.). I believe Doctor Nogueira is going to be in Washington on the 12th
of May at an International Congress and I shall be there also. If there is any
way I can help, please let me know by air mail or cable (collect).
div1.closer: Sincerely, P. S. Hench, M. D. P. S. H:alc
